member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.fillTree
member.summary:
method fillTree
This method is used to initially fill the treeView control with a list of available drives from which you can search for the desired folder.

member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.getSubDirs(System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode)
member.summary:
method getSubDirs
this function will scan the specified parent for any subfolders if they exist. To minimize the memory usage, we only scan a single folder level down from the existing, and only if it is needed. the parent folder in which to search for sub-folders.

member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.fixPath(System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode)
member.summary:
method fixPath
For some reason, the treeView will only work with paths constructed like the following example. "c:\\Program Files\Microsoft\...". What this method does is strip the leading "\\" next to the drive letter. the folder that needs it's path fixed for display. The correctly formatted full path to the selected folder.

member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: F:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.panel2
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.treeView1_BeforeSelect(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewCancelEventArgs)
member.summary:
method treeView1_BeforeSelect
Before we select a tree node we want to make sure that we scan the soon to be selected tree node for any sub-folders. this insures proper tree construction on the fly. The object that invoked this event The TreeViewCancelEventArgs event arguments.

member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.treeView1_BeforeExpand(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewCancelEventArgs)
member.summary:
method treeView1_BeforeExpand
Before we expand a tree node we want to make sure that we scan the soon to be expanded tree node for any sub-folders. this insures proper tree construction on the fly. The object that invoked this event The TreeViewCancelEventArgs event arguments.

member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.cancelBtn_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
method cancelBtn_Click
This method cancels the folder browsing.

member.name: M:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.selectBtn_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
method selectBtn_Click
This method accepts which ever folder is selected and closes this application with a DialogResult.OK result if you invoke this form though Form.ShowDialog(). In this example this method simply looks up the selected folder, and presents the user with a message box displaying the name and path of the selected folder.

member.name: P:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.Names
member.summary:
method name
A method to retrieve the short name for the selected folder. The folder name for the selected folder.

member.name: P:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.fullPath
member.summary:
method fullPath
Retrieve the full path for the selected folder. The correctly formatted full path to the selected folder.

member.name: P:compilatudo.folderSelect.FolderSelect.info
member.summary:
method info
Retrieve the full DirectoryInfo object associated with the selected folder. Note that this will not have the corrected full path string. The full DirectoryInfo object associated with the selected folder.
